intro: Onosma transrhymnensis, commonly known as the Transrhymnian fleabane, is a flowering plant belonging to the sunflower family (Asteraceae). It is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy, narrow leaves. Native to the arid regions of Central Asia, this species thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and is often found in open habitats such as steppes and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem, supporting various pollinators and contributing to local biodiversity.
